question: The Doppler effect applies to light.
The first televised presidential debate was between Jimmy Carter and Gerald Ford.
French is an official language in Canada.
Cucumbers are usually more than 90% water.
In Half-Life 2, if you play the zombies' speech in reverse, they actually speak coherent English.
No Game No Life first aired in 2014.
Several characters in "Super Mario 64" blink their eyes, including Mario himself.
Rhode Island is actually located on the US mainland, despite its name.
In 2008, Usain Bolt set the world record for the 100 meters with one shoelace untied.
In "Avatar: The Last Airbender" and "The Legend of Korra", Lavabending is a specialized bending technique of Firebending.
